headline: Mexican Breakfast Tacos
description: These Mexican breakfast tacos are a quick, easy, and tasty morning meal of warm tortillas filled with chorizo scrambled eggs, salsa, and hot sauce.

video.description: Spiced chorizo and scrambled eggs make 5-star breakfast tacos.
video.name: Authentic Mexican Breakfast Tacos

name: Mexican Breakfast Tacos
recipeIngredient: 1 dash hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco™), or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir sausage in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove sausage to a plate. Drain and discard grease; wipe the skillet clean with a paper towel.

Place the same skillet over medium heat and grease with cooking spray. Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl; pour into the prepared skillet. Cook and gently stir until scrambled and almost dry. Add sausage; continue to cook and stir until firm.
Meanwhile, warm a second skillet over high heat. Cook tortillas until hot and crispy on the edges, but still pliable, about 45 seconds per side.
Sprinkle Monterey Jack cheese evenly onto hot tortillas. Top each with scrambled eggs, salsa, and hot pepper sauce.

review.reviewBody: Added a bit of chopped sweet onion to the chorizo. Great flavor, straightforward preparation.

Made this for breakfast this morning. This was really good and we will be having it again. I couldn't find just 6 ounces of Chorizio sausage, I had to buy a whole pack of it which was 19 ounces. We made the whole pack of it and we used 7 eggs (I always buy extra large eggs so we only added 1 egg). I added some chopped green pepper and onion to the sausage when I was frying it. My husband doesn't like the corn tortillas so we used flour tortillas. Just the two of us, so we have some left over for quick breakfasts during this week!....Thanks much for the recipe!
So yummy!

I'm only give two stars for the recipe, this particular recipe. It's a flawed recipe and I will get to the point. But first let me say this I've probably eaten my own weight in Huevos con Chorizo over the last 40 years and it's a great simple Mexican breakfast taco so I encourage you to enjoy the recipes of Eggs with Chorizo. I wish that recipes would offer advice on 'chorizo' depending on your latin sausage chorizo can mean at least 10 different types of sausage and MOST or not that proper for scrambling with eggs. buy a fresh pork or beef chorizo that you can find in the refrigerated sections of Mexican friendly supermarkets. It come sin plastic tubes and is quite runny with chiles. Other types of 'chorizo' will not be as good.

The recipe as-is, is a bit bland. I added a mild pork sausage to the chorizo and cooked them together. I added diced avocado, diced tomatoes, chopped green onions, salsa, mexican shredded cheese and it came out perfect. You can also use ground beef instead of sausage and season the beef with a homemade taco seasoning recipe
Loved it. Husband loved it. This will be a regular Saturday morning breakfast now!
I added homestyle potatoes and onions
I suspect you have a typo and don\t mean to heat the tortilla 45 seconds each side! They wouldbe burned to a crisp! Should be 4 - 5 seconds Thank you.
Exactly what it should be, simple and tasty!
Another Texas girl here. I've been making these for many years. Other than green peppers and onions I also like to add hash browns or other types of fried potatoes.
Loved it!
bueno!
Pretty quick and easy to make. I added chopped onions with chorizo as it browned for extra flavor. Overall a delicious recipe that is definitely a repeater.
Made it this past Sunday 5 May for my daughter first communion party. It didn’t last long. It was excellent!!!
Simple, so good. I added red peppers in with the chorizo. Yes to corn tortillas.

Thanks for the recipe! Loved it! I used the soy chorizo from Trader Joe's (I don't eat pork) it was fantastic! I didn't have any milk but was able to make the egg mixture work without it, lol! Can't wait to try adding didn't stuff in the future!
We made this for breakfast this morning and will become a regular. The simplicity and flavor makes it a quick, great tasting, “trip to Mexico.”
I crumbled up queso and mixed it with the eggs I also did not add hot sauce or salsa, I felt it would take away from the flavor. I added cilantro to the top all in all it was great and filling!

This is very traditional. Our Mexican family makes them this way but we seldom use cheese. It is a taco (corn tortilla) and if you want a burrito, use flour tortillas. Rice or potatoes are a good addition for burritos. Splash a little vinegar (during cooking) or lime juice when served (op.) to brighten the flavors. Egg whites are not necessarily healthier. The egg yolk has all the vitamins and some of the protein. Cholesterol is hereditary according to my doctor. Mine is good and I eat whole eggs every day. I like my food a little hot, hubby doesn't so I use Tobasco or Louisiana hot sauce. We make our own salsa, we call it pico de gallo. Onions, tomatoes, fresh cilantro (no salt). Salt extracts the moisture from the veg.
Made a few minor adjustments, but we will most definitely be having this again and again I'm sure!
It was perfect for dinner with friends!
It was excellent, I will definitely make it again. So easy to make batch up for the week for quick breakfast at work.
Delicious. The chorizo was perfect after allowing it drain before combining. A few diced potatoes might be good cooked with chorizo.

Very good. Made it spicier because husband likes things hot.
He really liked it.
This was very good! The only thing I did differently, was put my tortilla in my toaster for a controlled amount of time. Cheating. I know. Great recipe. Thanks!
Only because you added MILK to the fricken eggs. that makes them not cook and makes me sick. NO milk, cooked all the way, = not sick.

I love this. I have always made my own chorizo (i don 't like salivary glands in the premade). I use the Tampico dry mix with regular breakfast sausage & marinatme overnight. It is much better & I control the amt. of spice.

The chorizo sausage is basically simply like a hot Italian sausage so if you aren't into spicy sausage use a mild type of sausage. But anyone who like the heat will enjoy this breakfast to start the day.
One commenter stated this is a basic recipe but from this you can dress it up anyway you like by adding ingredients.

I add a couple chopped mushrooms, diced peppers and onions to the chorizo and when that's all cooked, add an egg to hold it together. I prefer a flour burrito sized tortilla, assemble then bake until crispy. Salsa and sour cream garnish.

This is a nice basic recipe for breakfast tacos. Nothing fancy, but oh so satisfying. Depending on what's in the fridge, I sometimes will dress it up with sauteed red/green peppers or onions, potatoes, Hatch green chili's, etc. If you don't have Queso Fresco cheese, the Monterey Jack works just fine. And, no, I am not Mexican, but I too always serve this with Tapatio, Cholula, Valentina, or whatever hot sauce is at hand. My family loves this!
Great! I used leftover taco meat in lieu of chorizo. Everything else exactly as called for. Loved it!

I have been eating chorizo and eggs all my life. But never with Tabasco. Being of Mexican-America heritage, we use Tapatio or Cholula. We also do not make tacos but tear the tortilla in bite size pieces and scoop up the eggs.

This is quickly becoming a breakfast staple in my house. 
The only modification I made was to crisp the tortillas in a lightly oiled skilled. It really takes the recipe to another level. 

It's really easy. You just heat the oiled skillet over medium heat, place the tortilla in the skillet and quickly build the taco while it's still in the skillet, fold in half and serve.
I made a few changes as I have made it several times, Add a little , take away a little. Depends what I have on hand. I made it one time using Machaca, yummmmm-o

My Mexican mother in law taught me to fry the chorizo until almost done then add the scrambled egg mixture into the same skillet (why dirty an additional skillet?) , she also added finely chopped onion and garlic to the scrambled egg. Also, as she had a gas range she would warm the tortillas right on the burner. Of course homemade salsa was a must (for her the hotter the better !)

Something others forget to mention is how easy it is to sub other meats for the chorizo. Leftover meats from tacos, tamal fillings, etc. Made some tamales last night, ran out of masa, so breakfast tacos this morning!
What happened to the onion and bell pepper in this recipe that the video showed. That looked like a nice addition to the eggs and chorizo.

I have made this several times now. It is such a hearty,easy breakfast. I just use the sausage that I have on hand.Today it was just plain breakfast sausages. I saute peppers,onions,crumbled sausage together,add the beaten eggs.I use a cast iron pan for the corn tortillas . they get nice and crispy,top tortillas with egg,sausage mixture and cheese...eat with salsa...so yummy.
made it while camping. make all ingredients ahead of time and kept them in the cooler then for breakfast we have a sandwich iron so we cooked them in that until crispy so good
This dish was delicious my family loved it they loved it for Breakfast and also they had it for tea lovely

I made these with whole wheat tortillas. They were not spicy at all, on their own. I did add some cubed potatoes and onion; and used a very small amount of sour cream to hold the edges of the tortilla together. We have leftovers and will freeze some for grab-n-goes; but will add hot sauce to them before assembling to freeze. Not sure if I will make this again, but if I do I will be sure to add more spice while cooking.

first, Chorizo can be purchased as Pork or Beef, Perhaps it is also made from other fatty meats as well I have heard of Goat Chorizo, it is made from the Salivary glands, lymph nodes & jowels of the pig mixed with spices and packed in the casing which are the intestines. I was taught how to prepare chorizo by a mexican, you brown the chorizo add eggs and scramble together I prefer to add sharp cheddar cheese to melt in the mixture, I serve with sour creme and top with more cheese, Jack or Cheddar and avocado when available. I find this served with Corn tortillas better than flour. Someone asked about how to prepare black beans, 1st go to market, buy a package of black beans, follow cooking directions printed on the package, like any beans, you simply boil them slowly in water, can add onion garlic meat or whatever else you want, cook until soft easily mashed between your fingers.
My husband and I make this all the time. We add green or red pepper. He scoops it with his tortilla (the authentic way) but I like eating as a taco with fixings inside.
I did the recipe exactly as it was written. It was delicious. It will now be a staple of ours for weekends.
Could of been my chorizo, this lacked the flavor of the ones we get at our Mexican restaurant.

Before frying the chorizo, I fried some chopped onion and jalapeño (half chili) and then added the sausage, fried until it's a little brown and then added the whisked eggs, din't add milk......cook until firm and serve with hot tortillas, cheese is a good addition but refried beans are better.....
halved recipe and substituted leftover taco hamburger mix for sausage.
My family gobbled it up. It was absolutely delicious!

My sector in the office gets together every Friday for breakfast. Each Friday a different person in the group makes or brings something in for everyone to eat. This Friday was my turn and I brought in the breakfast tacos... Was a big hit! I made at home and bright in. Very easy to prepare. I added red peppers and onions to eggs. I cooked sausage separately because there is a vegetarian. I'm already planning to make again for camping trip!
Simple, quick, and delicious. No changes made, none needed. What a great breakfast!
Love the one star review for bottled hot sauce lol, this isn't Gordan Ramsey's Kitchen get a grip!
I add cooked home fries and top the chorizo, egg, and potatoes, with cheese, sour cream, and taco sauce. That's a huge success at our house.

All 5 because this is a great, easy recipe. So many variations from this recipe. I use either tofu or an organic turkey spicy sausage. Sometimes add spinach to the eggs. I do use an organic locally made hot sauce, but shouldn't get a 1 star because the hot sauce is bottled...

I heated up the chorizo , than added some chopped onion, removed to the side, scrambled my eggs, little S&P, sprinkled a little jalapeño powder, when eggs were just done, added the chorizo back in, heated up my flour tortillas, added a few slivered radish on top, fork tinned some crema on top, mmm, was delicious , actually I make breakfast tacos quite a bit .

This is one of my favorite Mexican dishes. I first learned about it from a co-worker who brought me this breakfast treat to try.
She called it "chilaquiles" and I think the only difference in the recipe seen here and what I enjoyed are the corn tortillas which were cut into triangles and mixed in with the sausage/egg and topped with cheese. That's the only change I would make to this tasty recipe--making the tortilla closer to bite size and included in the mixture.

Everything is great! I also used a smidgen of cumin powder. It adds that smokey flavor. I also used chihuahua cheese. Lastly.......no Chicago taco is complete unless you top it with diced onion and diced cilantro. That reeeeeeaaaally brings it all together.

I am always looking for fresh ideas for breakfast, & this idea caught my attention! I tried this recipe, but I used breakfast sausage, added garlic, green onions & cilantro. it is definitely a keeper for our family.

I've been making breakfast tacos for a long time by just trying my own recipes. I didn't think this was anything special. It was good, but not great and I don't think I'll bother making it again. I did like the corn tortillas. I will use those again for other recipes.
Used hot Italian sausage and mexican cheese shredded blend/
added onion, bell pepper and jalapeno. Easy and taste wonderful. Thanks for sharing
Easy and fast - just the way I like cooking in the morning! My husband loved it; my 9-year old son did not.

Made this for breakfast for my family this morning and it was excellent! I sautéed the chorizo with onion and red pepper. When you put all the ingredients in the corn tortilla, it tastes just like a taco. Will be making this again.

Very simple, very good. I used poblano peppers instead of green bells, and thinly sliced red onions. Spreading a thin layer of refried beans on the tortilla before the cheese is a variation I've used. Warmed Ro-Tel also makes a great topping.
-fox

Superb! I think a lot of the flavor of this will depend on the quality of your chorizo. I grew up with chorizo being scrambled with eggs and served up in tortillas with fried potatoes. THIS way, however, is MUCH better! We served ours up with monteray jack/green chile cheese, sour cream, cilantro and salsa for those who wanted it. I was surprised at how much better I liked this vs the "old" way!
Cilantro to top them off & fresh squeezed lime makes these breakfast tacos POP!! Yummy

I love these tacos! I have made them several times just as written. They are delicious. They're a great change from our traditional breakfast dishes. I like doubleing the recipe so I have left overs. They reheat well. The salsa on the top is great touch!

Great base recipe and can easily be personalized with extras as toppings (potatoes, cilantro, avacado, salsa fresca, black beans, onions, sour cream/plain yogurt, shredded cabbage). Reheats nicely in small potions, making it an easy weekday breakfast too)
Not my favorite. This was my first time trying chorizo that pretty much ruined the dish for me.
These are so good!

AWESOME recipe! Great directions, too. I usually make breakfast burritos for my husband and anyone that knows that burritos are usually made with flour tortillas and TACOS with corn tortillas can appreciate this recipe. I didn't change a THING! I will suggest using a cast iron skillet for heating the tortillas, that is what my mom always used, and Tapatio hot sauce. We owned a Mexican restaurant when I was little and my aunt was the prominent cook/chef and she made something similar to this for us in the morning with shredded cotija cheese. ANYONE that would give this recipe a mediocre or bad rating obviously does not know how to prepare these correctly so they should just stick to Jimmy Dean or McDonalds and quit trying to cook! SHEESH!

I don't like Chorizo so I use regular sausage or I add onion and red peppers to the eggs while I am cooking them. I don't use hot sauce, I use hot salsa. I also use flour tortillas. Breakfast tacos are my favorite breakfast since living in San Antonio, TX for 20 years. They were to die for there. A very wide variety of breakfast tacos.
Thought this was really good. Thanks for sharing the recipe Bearnesta!.... Tim & kids
You needed a recipe for this?

I was giving this exact recipe (with the pepper & onion from video) years ago from my south Texas sister-in-law. It's a great spicy hot breakfast guaranteed to warm up any tummy on a cold northern winter morning. I sometimes add a dollop of plain Greek yogurt to even out the heat.

I have no idea if these are "authentic" or not. However, I do know that they are OUTSTANDING. Followed the recipe except for the milk. Garnished with avocado and PW Restaurant Style Salsa. Will definitely make these again and often.
This was a fast and tasty breakfast. I used soyrizo (vegetarian chorizo) and it was delicious. Thanks for the quick and spicy breakfast taco recipe!
Yummy! It's a really fast way to make breakfast for the entire family.
Excellent and easy, one of our new favorite breakfasts. I love this recipe as is, but might try to vary it up in the future maybe by adding potatoes.

It was a hit at our home this morning for breakfast! Yum! I did saute some onions and mushrooms as suggested. I also had a leftover twice baked potato which I cutup and added to onions and mushrooms before adding the egg mixture! Delicious served with some salsa and sour cream! Next time I'll make sure I have some avocado to add.

Om nom nom tacos! nom nom...

I had some jalapenos and a tomato laying around, so I diced up borth about 1/4" chunks, and sautéed them in the pan for about 2 minutes before adding the egg/milk mixture, followed by the chorizo.
Also used Sharp Cheddar instead of Monterey, since I prefer cheddar and had some there.
Topped with a spoonful of sour cream!!
Om nom nom....
I have tried this recipe and it is amazing
Pretty basic breakfast burrito.

My husband is from Mexico and when we were first married, he would make this every Saturday (adding diced potatoes). I had not attempted to make it myself, so I thought I would surprise him. I made this all by myself and he was sooo impressed. Of course he had to show me up my making his homemade tortillas......but this recipe is something that I just LOVE! I can blame a little weight gain on this one here.
Pretty good! We didn't change the recipe this time. Next time, we are adding peppers and onions. I'd eat it either way.
My daughter and I made these tacos for Father's Day breakfast, and they were a big hit. My husband has requested they go into regular rotation for breakfast. Thank you for posting!
A delicious, quick and different twist for breakfast. I followed the recipe exactly except that I used shredded taco cheese that I had on hand instead of the shredded Monterey Jack. Yummy!

I am full blooded Hispanic come from a family who cooks all authentic Mexican food. In Our house we had bottled hot sauce, to this day still do for my own family. If you want the real thing its better to make salsa but is time consuming. I have been making this dish for years with my mother cooking and now with my children. Its a great recipe!

This is a regular at our home. I've been making chorizo and egg tacos, burritos, plates, etc., since I was a little kid. We always have a range of bottled hot sauces. You can save a pan by just adding the eggs to the chorizo. And save a pan for warming the tortillas if you have gas burners. Just warm them on the flames with tongs. Also a dab of sour cream, cilantro and cheddar are great compliments to this recipe. :)

It's a common egg & tortilla breakfast recipe... Americanized only with the shredded cheese & tabasco (use COTIJA CHEESE OR QUEZO FRESCO) & yes, most Mexicans use Bottled hot sauce ( Tapatio, Cholula, etc) ... Thanks for sharing!

Good recipe. I was very surprised that it didn't include onions and peppers. Like other reviewers, I added them anyway for more flavor. I served the tacos with a side of Patatas Bravas sans dipping sauce.
Great! I added enchilada sauce and put it in the oven for about 15 minutes. My husband adds guacamole and salsa. It was good just as the recipe is and only gets better with the additions.

My family loved this recipe and it truely is authentic. The flavor and heat are just right for us. This is in response for the reviewer that says Mexican families wouldn't use bottled hot sauce on their breakfast tacos. Living here in southern California, I have many hispanic neighbors and friends. They all use bottled hot sauce on their meals LOL.

I love Mexican food, and especially tacos! (However, I've come to prefer tostadas or quesadillas, as you get all layers of ingredients in each bite.) When I make this, I add the eggs into the cooked chorizo, so they mix with the juices (okay-FAT!) for more flavor. And to save a pan, you can heat your tortillas right over a gas burner - they get nice charred spots on them. And yes - BOO to grumpy BEACHQUEEN1! I know for a fact that lots of Mexicans DO eat bottled sauces & salsas - not everyone has the desire to make everything from scratch!

I haven't tried this, but.....we had a little Mexican place with two ladies that barely spot English close to my old job. Their breakfast burritos had some refried beans in them also. They were exceptional.
This is my new favorite taco. We took out the meat and put in onions, mushrooms and peppers that were sauteed in olive oil. Excellent meatless meal.

This is not what we eat here in Mexico, but it is what mexicans eat in the US. In here,when we have huevos con chorizo (eggs and chorizo) we just fry the chorizo and add the eggs ans salt, that is all, some people eat it with bread others like it with corn or wheat tortillas, but the tortillas are served aside, some take a tortilla and make a taco, others just take a bite of the eggs and then a bite of the tortilla, same with the salsa, homemade or from a can (not the liquid kind like tabasco or habanero, just green or red blended salsa), some like it some don't, I personally think the chorizo flavor is strong enough, pouring salsa over it is too much for me; and you can serve the dish with re-fried beans or fresh avocado slices. I just don't know where to get the Monterey Jack and I'll change the tortillas for tostadas, they will be easier to eat

Excellent!!! But some people are so critical- if you don't like say--bottled hot sauce??? add your own and move on--not take it out on the poor recipe poster!! Very bad taste and poor etiquette I would say!!! thumbs down on her!!! Excellent recipe BEARNESTA!!!
Very good with flour shells, I use breakfast sausage as a substitute .

I know if you change somethin,it aint the same..I swapped out the chorizo for soy chorizo just cuz my wife is vegetarian...Also i made this for 1st service breakfast at church..loved by all..multiplies really easy..and i can get fresh tortillas here in San Deigo
